gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Volodin, E.M., N.A. Diansky, and A.V. Gusev (2010). "Simulating Present-Day Climate with the INMCM4.0 Coupled Model of the Atmospheric and Oceanic General Circulations". Izvestia, Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 46, 414-431

componentProperty.value: Optical thickness scenario dependent on latitude and month was recommended for CMIP3

modelComponent.description: Deep and shallow convection is Betts_1986. Details of PBL turbulence and large scale condensation can be found in Alekseev_1998.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Alekseev, V.A., E.M. Volodin, V.Ya. Galin, V.P. Dymnikov, and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Modeling of the present-day climate by the atmospheric model of INM RAS DNM GCM. Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru
Betts, A.K (1986). "A new convective adjustment scheme. Part I. Observational and theoretical basis". Quart. J. Roy. Met. Soc, 112, 677-691.

modelComponent.description: Cloud amount is calculated diagnostically using relative humidity, temperature and vertical temperature gradient. Cloud overlap is maximum within each of 3 cloud layers (high, medium, low), but overlap of clouds between 3 cloud layers is random. Details can be found in Alekssev_1998. Present cloud amount calculation is slightly different from Alekseev_1998, but basic order remains the same.

componentProperty.value: Cloud amount is calculated using relative humidity and DT/Dz

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Alekseev, V.A., E.M. Volodin, V.Ya. Galin, V.P. Dymnikov, and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Modeling of the present-day climate by the atmospheric model of INM RAS DNM GCM. Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru

componentProperty.value: zero heat flux at the upper boundary
zero momentum flux at the upper boundary
second order in space and time
Laplas **4 for U, V, T, Q

modelComponent.description: Spatial difference scheme for U, V, T is constructed according to Arakawa_1977

componentProperty.value: Mean humidity and heat is conserved

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Arakawa, A., and V.R. Lamb (1977). "Computational design of the basic dynamical processes of the UCLA general circulation model". In Methods in Computational Physics, 17, J. Chang (ed.), Academic Press, New York, 173-265.

modelComponent.description: Orographic GWD is considered according to Palmer_1986. Non-orographic GWD is included according to Hines_1997. No convective gravity waves.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Hines, C.O. (1997). "Doppler spread parameterization of gravity wave momentum deposition in the middle atmosphere. Part 1. Basic formulation". J. Atm. Sol. Terr. Physics, 59, 371-386.

Palmer, T.N., G.J. Shutts, and R. Swinbank (1986). "Alleviation of a systematic westerly bias in general circulation and numerical weather prediction model through an orographic gravity wave drag parameterization". Quart. J. Roy. Met. Soc., 112, 1001-1031.

modelComponent.description: Details of atmospheric radiation see in Alekseev_1998, Galin_1998 In radiation, additional artificial "zero" level appears above the uppermost model level. Therefore, for radiation fluxes we have 23 levels, while in atmospheric dynamics there are 21 levels only.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Alekseev, V.A., E.M. Volodin, V.Ya. Galin, V.P. Dymnikov, and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Modeling of the present-day climate by the atmospheric model of INM RAS DNM GCM. Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru
Galin, V.Ya, (1998). "Parameterization of radiation processes in atmpsoheric model of INM RAS". Izvestia. Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 34, 380-389.

documentRelationship.description: Spatial resolution was increased from 5x4 to 2x1.5 degrees in longitude and latitude. In general, main details are the same. The difference is in some numerical coefficients.

componentProperty.description: Land ice albedo is function of temperature, see Alekseev_1998.

modelComponent.description: see Alekseev_1998 for details

componentProperty.description: Details of land surface scheme can be seen in Volodin_1998 or Alekseev_1998. Coupling with the atmosphere is done using iterations.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Alekseev, V.A., E.M. Volodin, V.Ya. Galin, V.P. Dymnikov, and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Modeling of the present-day climate by the atmospheric model of INM RAS DNM GCM. Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru

Volodin, E.M., and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Parameterization of heat and moisture transfer in the soil-vegetation system for use in atmospheric general circulation models. 1. Formulation and simulations based on local observational data". Izvestia. Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 34, 453-465.

modelComponent.description: Snow free albedo is prescribes for 4 seasons. Snow albedo is calculated using surface temperature and vegetation type.
Soil and vegetation carbon are calculated according to LSM1.0 (Bonan_1996). Carbon cycle in INM model is described in Volodin_2007.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Bonan, G.B. (1996) "A Land Surface Model (LSM Version 1.0) for Ecological, Hydrological and Atmospheric Studies: Technical Description and User's Guide" NCAR Technical Note, No. 417.
Volodin, E.M. (2007). "Atmosphere-ocean general circulation model with the carbon cycle". Izvestia, Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 43, 266-280.

modelComponent.description: Vegetation carbon cycle is parametrized according to Bonan_1996, but with calculated LAI rather than prescribed. Climate model with carbon cycle is described in Volodin_2007.

componentProperty.value: total carbon amount for each vegetation type calculated. Distribution of total carbon among stems, roots is prescribed

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Bonan, G.B. (1996) "A Land Surface Model (LSM Version 1.0) for Ecological, Hydrological and Atmospheric Studies: Technical Description and User's Guide" NCAR Technical Note, No. 417.
Volodin, E.M. (2007). "Atmosphere-ocean general circulation model with the carbon cycle". Izvestia, Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 43, 266-280.

modelComponent.description: Surface temperature and surface sensible and latent heat flux are calculated for 4 surface land types: bare soil, vegetation, snow cover, inland water. Ther is no subsurface tiling. Evaporation is formulated in terms of relative humidity for bare soil (alpha) and in terms of resistance for vegetation (beta). See details in Alekseev_1998.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Alekseev, V.A., E.M. Volodin, V.Ya. Galin, V.P. Dymnikov, and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Modeling of the present-day climate by the atmospheric model of INM RAS DNM GCM. Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru

modelComponent.description: In lakes that are explicitely resolved by oceanic model (1x0.5 degrees in longitude and latitude) 3-dimensional model similar to oceanic model is worked. Unresolved lakes are parameterized as fraction of gridcell covered by very thin water layer (in the case of surface temperature above 0C)
See details in Alekseev_1998

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Alekseev, V.A., E.M. Volodin, V.Ya. Galin, V.P. Dymnikov, and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Modeling of the present-day climate by the atmospheric model of INM RAS DNM GCM. Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru

modelComponent.description: All soil is divided into 11 types according to percent of sand, clay and organics. Coefficients for thermal and water conductivity, water table, and some other constants are prescribed for 11 soil types, see Alekseev_1998, Volodin_1998.

componentProperty.value: 11 soil types are prescribed according to percent of sand, clay and organics
albedo of bare soil is prescribed, as well as vegetation albedo for 4 seasons
water table is prescribed according to 11 soil types

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Alekseev, V.A., E.M. Volodin, V.Ya. Galin, V.P. Dymnikov, and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Modeling of the present-day climate by the atmospheric model of INM RAS DNM GCM. Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru

Volodin, E.M., and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Parameterization of heat and moisture transfer in the soil-vegetation system for use in atmospheric general circulation models. 1. Formulation and simulations based on local observational data". Izvestia. Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 34, 453-465.

modelComponent.description: Heat diffusion is considered in snow (3 leyers) and soil (23 layers) includion freezing/melting according to Alekseev_1998, Volodin_1998.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Alekseev, V.A., E.M. Volodin, V.Ya. Galin, V.P. Dymnikov, and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Modeling of the present-day climate by the atmospheric model of INM RAS DNM GCM. Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru

Volodin, E.M., and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Parameterization of heat and moisture transfer in the soil-vegetation system for use in atmospheric general circulation models. 1. Formulation and simulations based on local observational data". Izvestia. Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 34, 453-465.

componentProperty.value: ice amount is calculated using data of temperature and heat flux

modelComponent.description: Potential vegetation is prescribed (fixed) according to Wilson_1985. Actual vegetation is calculated using potential vegetation, available water in root zone and soil temperature. Details are in Alekseev_1998.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Alekseev, V.A., E.M. Volodin, V.Ya. Galin, V.P. Dymnikov, and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Modeling of the present-day climate by the atmospheric model of INM RAS DNM GCM. Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru
Wilson, W.F., and A. Henderson-Sellers (1985). "A global archive of land cover and soils data for use in general circulation climate models". Journal of Climatology, 5, 119-143.

modelComponent.description: River runoff calculated in river basin gridpoint is summarized and moves to river mouth instantaneousely, where it influences on oceanic dynamics. Evaporation from inland water (subgrid-scale lakes, wetlands, irrigation land) treated as negative river runoff.
See details in Volodin_etal_2010, Marchuk_etal_2010.

componentProperty.description:
Fortran function for equation of state:
C SEA WATER DENSITY DEVIATION FROM 1.02 [GR/CM**3] C AS FUNCTION OF T[C](potential),S[PPT],P[MPa] C By Bryden et al.:"A new approximation of the equation of state for C seawater, suitable for numerical ocean models." C In: J.Geophis.Res.,v.104,No.C1, p.1537-1540, 1999.
REAL PRESTOMPA,T,S,P,DENP PARAMETER(PRESTOMPA=1.0E-07)
DENP(T,S,P) =-2.00920601E-02 C 1 + ( 5.07043E-04*P-5.43283E-07*P*P) 2 + ( 5.10768E-05-3.69119E-06*P+6.54837E-09*P*P)*T 3 + ( 8.05999E-04-9.34012E-07*P+1.38777E-09*P*P)*S 4 + (-7.40849E-06+5.33243E-08*P-1.01563E-10*P*P)*T*T 5 + (-3.01036E-06+1.75145E-08*P-2.34892E-11*P*P)*T*S 6 + ( 3.32267E-08-3.25887E-10*P+4.98612E-13*P*P)*T*T*T 7 + ( 3.21931E-08-1.65849E-10*P+2.17612E-13*P*P)*T*T*S
Time scheme for temperature and salinity is Matsuno scheme: X(n+1*)=X(n)+F(X(n)) X(n+1)=X(n)+F(X(n+1*)) Time scheme for momentun is semiimplicit. See Marchuk_etal_2010 for details.

componentProperty.value: TF=-0.0575*S, where TF - freezing point (C), and S - salinity (promille)
river runoff comes to uppermost model layer without any additional mixing
2 hours for barotropic solver and momentum, 20 minutes for temperature and salinity

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Marchuk, G.I., V.B. Zalesny, V.I. Agoshkov, A.V. Bagno, A.V. Gusev, N.A. Diansky, S.N. Moshonkin, R.Tamsalu, and E.M. Volodin (2010). "Numerical simulation of large-scale ocean circulation based on multicomponent splitting method". Russian Journal of Numerical Analysis and Mathematical Modeling, 25, 581-609.

Volodin, E.M., N.A. Diansky, and A.V. Gusev (2010). "Simulating Present-Day Climate with the INMCM4.0 Coupled Model of the Atmospheric and Oceanic General Circulations". Izvestia, Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 46, 414-431

modelComponent.description: See Marchuk_etal_2010

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Marchuk, G.I., V.B. Zalesny, V.I. Agoshkov, A.V. Bagno, A.V. Gusev, N.A. Diansky, S.N. Moshonkin, R.Tamsalu, and E.M. Volodin (2010). "Numerical simulation of large-scale ocean circulation based on multicomponent splitting method". Russian Journal of Numerical Analysis and Mathematical Modeling, 25, 581-609.

modelComponent.description: Isopycnal diffusion with constant coefficient and Laplas**2 at sigma-surfaces are applied for temperature and salinity. Laplas**2 and Laplas**4 at sigma-surfaces with constant coefficients are applied for u, v.
Laplas**2 at model sigma-surfaces with constant coefficient 8e+13 m4/s as well as Laplas**4 at model sigma-surfaces with constant coefficient 1.2e+27 m8/s are applied for momentum
Isopycnal diffusion with constant coefficient of 8e+2 m2/s, and Laplas**2 at model sigma-surfaces with constant coefficient of 8e+13m4/s are applied for temperature and salinity.
No specific treatment of bottom boundary layer, bottom friction only.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Marchuk, G.I., V.B. Zalesny, V.I. Agoshkov, A.V. Bagno, A.V. Gusev, N.A. Diansky, S.N. Moshonkin, R.Tamsalu, and E.M. Volodin (2010). "Numerical simulation of large-scale ocean circulation based on multicomponent splitting method". Russian Journal of Numerical Analysis and Mathematical Modeling, 25, 581-609.

modelComponent.description: See Marchuk_etal_2010.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Marchuk, G.I., V.B. Zalesny, V.I. Agoshkov, A.V. Bagno, A.V. Gusev, N.A. Diansky, S.N. Moshonkin, R.Tamsalu, and E.M. Volodin (2010). "Numerical simulation of large-scale ocean circulation based on multicomponent splitting method". Russian Journal of Numerical Analysis and Mathematical Modeling, 25, 581-609.

modelComponent.description: Mixed layer is paramererized by vertical diffusion (Philander-Pakanowsky), but with additional mixing induced by wind waves. Maximum coefficient is 5e-2 m2/s for tracers and momentum.

Ocean BioGeoChemistry is very simple and contains advection of total carbon amount by oceanic currents, CO2 exchange at the ocean-atmosphere surface and simple parameterization of biological pump that takes carbon in the uppermost 100m and returns it in near-bottom layers. The strength of biological pump is prescribed and not depends on space and time. See details in Volodin_2007.

componentProperty.description: There is no explicit biology in the model. Transport of total carbon amount only

componentProperty.value: total carbon amount is calculated only, no other biogeochemistry

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Volodin, E.M. (2007). "Atmosphere-ocean general circulation model with the carbon cycle". Izvestia, Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 43, 266-280.

modelComponent.description: Exchange of CO2 is taken into account only. Ocean-atmosphere flux is calculated using bulk-formulae, in the same manner as heat or moisture flux. See details in Volodin_2007.

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Volodin, E.M. (2007). "Atmosphere-ocean general circulation model with the carbon cycle". Izvestia, Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 43, 266-280.

modelComponent.description: See details of ice dynamics and thermodynamics in Iakovlev_2008.

componentProperty.value: ice area, ice mass, snow mass, U, V, x-component of stress tensor, y-component of stress tensor, xy-component of stress tensor
4 min for dynamics, 2 hours for thermodynamics

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Iakovlev, N.G. (2008). "Reproduction of the Large-Scale State of Water and Sea Ice in the Arctic Ocean in 1948-2002: Part I. Numerical Model". Izvestiya, Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 45, 357-371.

modelComponent.description: Advection using MPDATA with upwind finite difference first order scheme (Iakovlev_2008).

componentProperty.value: no ice strength, the only sea ice cathegory is considered

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Iakovlev, N.G. (2008). "Reproduction of the Large-Scale State of Water and Sea Ice in the Arctic Ocean in 1948-2002: Part I. Numerical Model". Izvestiya, Atmospheric and Oceanic Physics, 45, 357-371.

componentProperty.value: area change calculates in assumption that new ice thickness is 0.05m
thermal properties depending on S-T (fixed salinity)

documentRelationship.description:
Horizontal resolution in the atmosphere was increased fro 5x4 to 2x1.5 degrees.
Resolution in the ocean was increased from 2.5x2 to 1x0.5 degrees. Generalized spherical coordinate with rotated poles rather than usual spherical coordinate was used. Fresh water flux adjustment was removed. Carbon cycle was included.

reference.name: piControl
reference.description: Reference to an Experiment called piControl with experimentNumber 3.1

authorsList.list: Volodin, E.M., Diansky N.A., Gusev A.V.

conformance.description: Initial condition obtained as final point of long run (~200 yrs) with preindustrial conditions

reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called ic.001 in a experiment called 3.1 piControl

reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.002 in a experiment called 3.1 piControl

reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called stc.024 in a experiment called 3.1 piControl

conformance.description: ozone was prescribed as annual cycle for 1850 in recommended forcing

reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.005 in a experiment called 3.1 piControl

reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.006 in a experiment called 3.1 piControl

conformance.description: Aerosol climatology depends on latitude and ocean/land mask, and not depends on time. See Alekseev_1998 for details.

reference.name: bc.004
reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.004 in a experiment called 3.1 piControl

deployment.description: The resources(deployment) on which this simulation ran

reference.name: server1
reference.description: Reference to a platform called server1

reference.name: inmcm4
reference.description: Reference to a modelComponent called inmcm4

standard.name: QN_DRS
standard.description: The QN_DRS value allows mapping from data files to metadata being exported from the metadata questionnaire, and contains the insitution name, the model name on which the simulation was run, and the experiment name to which the simulation conforms. Additionally, for a non-ensemble run, a rip value will be included. The format of the string will thus be: institute_model_experiment.

numericalExperiment.rationale: Pre-Industrial Control. Control experiment against which perturbations are compared.
numericalExperiment.description: Pre-Industrial coupled atmosphere/ocean control run. Imposes non-evolving pre-industrial conditions.

initialCondition.name: 3.1.ic
initialCondition.description: A description of initial condition for the control run.

boundaryCondition.name: 3.1.bc.wmg_conc
boundaryCondition.description: Prescribed atmospheric concentrations of pre-industrial well mixed gases: excluding CO2

boundaryCondition.name: 3.1.bc.CO2_conc
boundaryCondition.description: Prescribed atmospheric concentrations of pre-industrial well mixed gas: Carbon Dioxide

boundaryCondition.name: 3.1.bc.sls_conc
boundaryCondition.description: Prescribed atmospheric concentration of pre-industrial short lived (reactive) gas species

boundaryCondition.name: 3.1.bc.nat_aer
boundaryCondition.description: Prescribed concentrations or emissions of pre-industrial natural aerosols

boundaryCondition.name: 3.1.bc.nat_aer_precur
boundaryCondition.description: Prescribed concentrations or emissions of pre-industrial natural aerosol precursors

boundaryCondition.name: 3.1.bc.sl_aer
boundaryCondition.description: Prescribed concentrations or emissions of pre-industrial short lived (reactive) aerosol species

esmModelGrid.description: Spherical uniform grid with steps equal 2 degrees in longitude and 1.5 degrees in latitude. 21 sigma-levels in vertical.

horizontalResolution.description: 2x1.5 degrees in longitude and latitude. Refinement details: no

esmModelGrid.description: Horizontal grid use grneralized spherical coordinates with ploes shifted outside oceanic domain. Vertical grid is sigma.

horizontalResolution.description: 1x0.5 degrees in longitude and latitude. Refinement details: no

gridTile.mnemonic: generalized spherical coordinates with poles displaced outside ocean
